intro: [WRONG START] Discocactus zehntneri var. horstiorium, commonly known as the Horstiorum Discocactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its globular or cylindrical shape, with ribbed stems that often develop a bluish-gray hue. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring or early summer. It is a slow-growing succulent that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
